results.definition: an unofficial association of people or groups
a road junction at which traffic streams circularly around a central island
form or draw a circle around

examples: the machine punched out metal circles

results.definition: a curved section or tier of seats in a hall or theater or opera house; usually the first tier above the orchestra
examples: they had excellent seats in the dress circle

results.definition: ellipse in which the two axes are of equal length; a plane curve generated by one point moving at a constant distance from a fixed point
examples: he calculated the circumference of the circle

results.definition: move in a circular path above (someone or something)
examples: the plane circled, looking for a landing spot

results.definition: something approximating the shape of a circle
examples: the chairs were arranged in a circle
